entry.title: Meeting Time Poll for Fall 2018
entry.summary:
Welcome back everyone!

With the start of a new semester, we have to once again agree on a meeting time. As usual, we will meet for one hour each Friday at some time around noon. Please indicate your scheduling constraints at the when2meet poll.
entry.content:
Welcome back everyone!

With the start of a new semester, we have to once again agree on a meeting time. As usual, we will meet for one hour each Friday at some time around noon. Please indicate your scheduling constraints at the when2meet poll.

entry.title: Discussion on Advances in Tier-Based Strict Locality
entry.summary:
Hi all!

This Friday, March 9th, James Rogers from earlham college is visiting our dept. We will have a free-form discussion and brainstorm of various advances in Tier-Based Strictly Local Languages. No reading is required, though familiarity with formal languages and the Subregular Hierarchy will be helpful. Hope to see â€¦
entry.content:
Hi all!

This Friday, March 9th, James Rogers from earlham college is visiting our dept. We will have a free-form discussion and brainstorm of various advances in Tier-Based Strictly Local Languages. No reading is required, though familiarity with formal languages and the Subregular Hierarchy will be helpful. Hope to see you all there!

entry.title: Thomas Continues on Tree Transducers
entry.summary:
Hi all!

This Friday, March 9th, Thomas will continue discussing Tree automata and transducers. No reading is required. Hope to see you all there!
entry.content:

entry.title: Schedule and Meeting Time
entry.summary:
Hi all!

We revised the meeting time for this semester to: 1:30-2:30 pm, Fridays. The next meeting (2/9) is cancelled.
entry.content:
Hi all!

We revised the meeting time for this semester to: 1:30-2:30 pm, Fridays. The next meeting (2/9) is cancelled.

entry.title: Schedule and First Meeting
entry.summary:
Hi all!

The meeting time for this semester is Fridays, 11:15-12:15 pm. The next meeting will be held on February 2. Jeff Heinz will give an introduction to Automata Theory, string/tree transductions, and Myhill-Nerode.

Hope to see you all there!
entry.content:
Hi all!

The meeting time for this semester is Fridays, 11:15-12:15 pm. The next meeting will be held on February 2. Jeff Heinz will give an introduction to Automata Theory, string/tree transductions, and Myhill-Nerode.

Hope to see you all there!
